title: Generate Table of Contents for Repo
description: Generate a logically organized table of contents for a CONTRIBUTING.md file
example_prompt: Analyze the CONTRIBUTING.md file and create a well-structured table of contents. Include all major sections and subsections, using consistent formatting and logical organization.
example_result:
I've analyzed the CONTRIBUTING.md file and generated a table of contents. Here's the structured output:

```markdown
# Contributing to Project Name

## Table of Contents

1. [Getting Started](#getting-started)
   - [Prerequisites](#prerequisites)
   - [Development Environment](#development-environment)
   - [Code Style Guide](#code-style-guide)

2. [Development Workflow](#development-workflow)
   - [Branching Strategy](#branching-strategy)
   - [Commit Messages](#commit-messages)
   - [Pull Requests](#pull-requests)
   - [Code Review Process](#code-review-process)

3. [Testing Guidelines](#testing-guidelines)
   - [Unit Tests](#unit-tests)
   - [Integration Tests](#integration-tests)
   - [Performance Tests](#performance-tests)
   - [Test Coverage Requirements](#test-coverage-requirements)

4. [Documentation](#documentation)
   - [Code Documentation](#code-documentation)
   - [API Documentation](#api-documentation)
   - [Example Usage](#example-usage)
   - [Architecture Diagrams](#architecture-diagrams)

5. [Release Process](#release-process)
   - [Version Numbering](#version-numbering)
   - [Release Checklist](#release-checklist)
   - [Deployment Steps](#deployment-steps)

6. [Community Guidelines](#community-guidelines)
   - [Code of Conduct](#code-of-conduct)
   - [Issue Reporting](#issue-reporting)
   - [Feature Requests](#feature-requests)
   - [Community Meetings](#community-meetings)

7. [Support](#support)
   - [Getting Help](#getting-help)
   - [Troubleshooting](#troubleshooting)
   - [FAQ](#faq)

8. [Legal](#legal)
   - [License](#license)
   - [Contributor License Agreement](#contributor-license-agreement)
   - [Third-party Dependencies](#third-party-dependencies)
```

Implementation Notes:

1. Structure
   - Organized in hierarchical order of engagement
   - Maximum 3 levels deep for clarity
   - Related topics grouped together

2. Formatting
   - Consistent indentation for subsections
   - All sections properly linked
   - Clear numbering system

3. Navigation
   - All links are lowercase, hyphenated
   - Sections ordered by logical flow
   - Progressive disclosure of information

4. Coverage
   - Technical aspects (development, testing)
   - Process details (workflow, releases)
   - Community aspects (guidelines, support)
   - Legal requirements

5. Maintainability
   - Each section is distinct
   - Easy to update and expand
   - Follows standard markdown practices
